TopicTitle: This part of this song should be used for the space ambient in KSP 2

Articles.Content:
It just feels like a perfect match with the shown trailers.

Edited October 15, 2019 by Bej Kerman

I think music is a subjective thing.
Someone like ambient, someone metal, someone generally rap :0
I personally generally turn off the music in the game settings and listen to the background AC/DC, NightWish, Rammstein and the like
I frequently forget KSP even has music as I leave the game muted.
KSP2 should have a varied selection of bespoke tracks. KSP1 only has a few decent tracks, the rest are repetitive, generic, royalty-free music found on the internet.

5 hours ago, Dragon01 said:

KSP2 should have a varied selection of bespoke tracks. KSP1 only has a few decent tracks, the rest are repetitive, generic, royalty-free music found on the internet.

I'll say, one place we deal with at work put me on hold and there was some KSP music right there. I was like... ooo-kay?

And I'll reprise one of the suggestion I made many years back:  Even if the game comes with music, allow us to edit some cfg file and set paths for mp3 music.
Like if I want "Mars, the Bringer of War" when I enter Duna's atmosphere or "Arvo Pärt- Spiegel im Spiegel" when flying in Eeloo sphere of Influence.... then I should be able to.

Edited October 16, 2019 by Francois424

The Latin music in the Tropico series is about the only in-game music I don't mute immediately.  If there's no option to mute music, I mute the whole game.

Hypocritically, I now propose The Primitives' Way Behind Me for every launch.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1fjehtGnvS0.  Naturally matched with the same band's Crash for every landing.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1y7NGqfZteg

Apologies for ear-worms *grin*

Did everyone miss the memo?

KSP 2 Developer video. KSP 2 has a musician on staff doing as far as I can tell situational sound tracks.

6 hours ago, mattinoz said:

Did everyone miss the memo?

KSP 2 Developer video. KSP 2 has a musician on staff doing as far as I can tell situational sound tracks.

I didn't catch that to be honest.  I was more focused on >> PERFORMANCE INCREASES <<  and that Ringed planet with icy moon.
Let's hope it's good.  Most game music are, but I have known some that gets annoying after a while.

37 minutes ago, Francois424 said:

I didn't catch that to be honest.  I was more focused on >> PERFORMANCE INCREASES <<  and that Ringed planet with icy moon.
Let's hope it's good.  Most game music are, but I have known some that gets annoying after a while.

Yes game music tends to get highly repeative if the game has decent replay value. It is usually the first thing turned off for me.

I was sort of hoping with Arcade Apple would have done something cool with game music and music streaming like letting developer pick a mood, tempo, character for the current game situation and pick tracks from the players library/likes to suit.
